text: about the idea of God that if you have
to look for your moral principles to
some other being who tells you whether
they are right or wrong it's like being
a child that's what happens when we're
children and our parents tell us this is
good and that as bad but what happens to
all of us is that we grow up to the
point where we don't want our parents to
tell us that anymore and we can make
those choices for ourselves and I think
the problem with the idea of God is that
it preserves that infant relationship to
another arbiter and I just rather do
without it myself having said that I
don't think I don't think he's going
anywhere anytime soon doesn't have here
that way so one has to deal with it
